verses.verse: But king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> loved<WH157> many<WH7227> strange<WH5237> women<WH802>, together with the daughter<WH1323> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, women of the Moabites<WH4125>, Ammonites<WH5984>, Edomites<WH130>, Zidonians<WH6722>, and Hittites<WH2850>;

Of the nations<WH1471> concerning which the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, You shall not go in<WH935> to them<WH935>, neither shall they come in unto you<WH403>: for surely they will turn away<WH5186> your heart<WH3824> after<WH310> their gods<WH430>: Solomon<WH8010> joined<WH1692> unto these in love<WH157>.
And he had seven<WH7651> hundred<WH3967> wives<WH802>, princesses<WH8282>, and three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> concubines<WH6370>: and his wives<WH802> turned away<WH5186> his heart<WH3820>.

For it came to pass<WH6256>, when Solomon<WH8010> was old<WH2209>, that his wives<WH802> turned away<WH5186> his heart<WH3824> after<WH310> other<WH312> gods<WH430>: and his heart<WH3824> was not perfect<WH8003> with the Lord<WH3068> his God<WH430>, as was the heart<WH3824> of David<WH1732> his father<WH1>.
For Solomon<WH8010> went<WH3212> after<WH310> Ashtoreth<WH6253> the goddess<WH430> of the Zidonians<WH6722>, and after<WH310> Milcom<WH4445> the abomination<WH8251> of the Ammonites<WH5984>.
And Solomon<WH8010> did<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the Lord<WH3068>, and went not fully<WH4390> after<WH310> the Lord<WH3068>, as did David<WH1732> his father<WH1>.

Then did Solomon<WH8010> build<WH1129> an high place<WH1116> for Chemosh<WH3645>, the abomination<WH8251> of Moab<WH4124>, in the hill<WH2022> that is before<WH6440> Jerusalem<WH3389>, and for Molech<WH4432>, the abomination<WH8251> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>.
And likewise did<WH6213> he for all his strange<WH5237> wives<WH802>, which burnt incense<WH6999> and sacrificed<WH2076> unto their gods<WH430>.

And the Lord<WH3068> was angry<WH599> with Solomon<WH8010>, because his heart<WH3824> was turned<WH5186> from the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, which had appeared<WH7200> unto him twice<WH6471>,

And had commanded<WH6680> him concerning this thing<WH1697>, that he should not go<WH3212> after<WH310> other<WH312> gods<WH430>: but he kept<WH8104> not that which the Lord<WH3068> commanded<WH6680>.

Therefore the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Solomon<WH8010>, Forasmuch as this is done of you<WH8104>, and you have not kept my covenant<WH1285> and my statutes<WH2708>, which I have commanded<WH6680> you<WH7167>, I will surely tear<WH7167> the kingdom<WH4467> from you<WH5414>, and will give it to your servant<WH5650>.
Nevertheless in your days<WH3117> I will not do<WH6213> it for David<WH1732> your father<WH1>'s sake<WH7167>: but I will tear it out of the hand<WH3027> of your son<WH1121>.

But<WH7535> I will not tear away<WH7167> all the kingdom<WH4467>; but will give<WH5414> one<WH259> tribe<WH7626> to your son<WH1121> for David<WH1732> my servant<WH5650>'s sake<WH3389>, and for Jerusalem's sake which I have chosen<WH977>.
And the Lord<WH3068> stirred up<WH6965> an adversary<WH7854> unto Solomon<WH8010>, Hadad<WH1908> the Edomite<WH130>: he was of the king<WH4428>'s seed<WH2233> in Edom<WH123>.

For it came to pass<WH1732>, when David was in Edom<WH123>, and Joab<WH3097> the captain<WH8269> of the army<WH6635> was gone up<WH5927> to bury<WH6912> the slain<WH2491>, after he had struck<WH5221> every male<WH2145> in Edom<WH123>;
(For six<WH8337> months<WH2320> did Joab<WH3097> remain<WH3427> there with all Israel<WH3478>, until he had cut off<WH3772> every male<WH2145> in Edom<WH123>:)

That Hadad<WH111> fled<WH1272>, he and certain<WH582> Edomites<WH130> of his father<WH1>'s servants<WH5650> with him<WH935>, to go into Egypt<WH4714>; Hadad<WH1908> being yet a little<WH6996> child<WH5288>.

And they arose<WH6965> out of Midian<WH4080>, and came<WH935> to Paran<WH6290>: and they took<WH3947> men<WH582> with them out of Paran<WH6290>, and they came<WH935> to Egypt<WH4714>, unto Pharaoh<WH6547> king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714>; which gave<WH5414> him an house<WH1004>, and appointed<WH559> him food<WH3899>, and gave<WH5414> him land<WH776>.

And Hadad<WH1908> found<WH4672> great<WH3966> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, so that he gave<WH5414> him to wife<WH802> the sister<WH269> of his own wife<WH802>, the sister<WH269> of Tahpenes<WH8472> the queen<WH1377>.

And the sister<WH269> of Tahpenes<WH8472> bore<WH3205> him Genubath<WH1592> his son<WH1121>, whom Tahpenes<WH8472> weaned<WH1580> in<WH8432> Pharaoh<WH6547>'s house<WH1004>: and Genubath<WH1592> was in Pharaoh<WH6547>'s household<WH1004> among<WH8432> the sons<WH1121> of Pharaoh<WH6547>.

And when Hadad<WH1908> heard<WH8085> in Egypt<WH4714> that David<WH1732> slept<WH7901> with his fathers<WH1>, and that Joab<WH3097> the captain<WH8269> of the army<WH6635> was dead<WH4191>, Hadad<WH1908> said<WH559> to Pharaoh<WH6547>, Let me depart<WH7971>, that I may go<WH3212> to my own country<WH776>.

Then Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> unto him<WH2638>, But what have you lacked with me<WH1245>, that, behold, you seek to go<WH3212> to your own country<WH776>? And he answered<WH559>, Nothing<WH7971>: but let me go anyway.

And God<WH430> stirred him up<WH6965> another adversary<WH7854>, Rezon<WH7331> the son<WH1121> of Eliadah<WH450>, which fled<WH1272> from his lord<WH113> Hadadezer<WH1909> king<WH4428> of Zobah<WH6678>:

And he gathered<WH6908> men<WH582> unto him<WH8269>, and became captain over a band<WH1416>, when David<WH1732> killed<WH2026> them of Zobah<WH3212>: and they went to Damascus<WH1834>, and lived<WH3427> in it<WH4427>, and reigned in Damascus<WH1834>.

And he was an adversary<WH7854> to Israel<WH3478> all the days<WH3117> of Solomon<WH8010>, beside the mischief<WH7451> that Hadad<WH1908> did<WH6973>: and he abhorred Israel<WH3478>, and reigned<WH4427> over Syria<WH758>.

And Jeroboam<WH3379> the son<WH1121> of Nebat<WH5028>, an Ephrathite<WH673> of Zereda<WH6868>, Solomon<WH8010>'s servant<WH5650>, whose mother<WH517>'s name<WH8034> was Zeruah<WH6871>, a widow<WH490> woman<WH802>, even he lifted up<WH7311> his hand<WH3027> against the king<WH4428>.

And this was the cause<WH1697> that he lifted up<WH7311> his hand<WH3027> against the king<WH4428>: Solomon<WH8010> built<WH1129> Millo<WH4407>, and repaired<WH5462> the breaches<WH6556> of the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732> his father<WH1>.

And the man<WH376> Jeroboam<WH3379> was a mighty man<WH1368> of valor<WH2428>: and Solomon<WH8010> seeing<WH7200> the young man<WH5288> that he was industrious<WH6213>, he made him ruler<WH6485> over all the charge<WH5447> of the house<WH1004> of Joseph<WH3130>.

And it came to pass at that time<WH6256> when Jeroboam<WH3379> went out<WH3318> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, that the prophet<WH5030> Ahijah<WH281> the Shilonite<WH7888> found<WH4672> him in the way<WH1870>; and he had clad<WH3680> himself with a new<WH2319> garment<WH8008>; and they two<WH8147> were alone in the field<WH7704>:
And Ahijah<WH281> caught<WH8610> the new<WH2319> garment<WH8008> that was on him<WH7167>, and tore it in twelve<WH8147> pieces<WH7168>:

And he said<WH559> to Jeroboam<WH3379>, Take<WH3947> you ten<WH6235> pieces<WH7168>: for thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, Behold<WH7167>, I will tear the kingdom<WH4467> out of the hand<WH3027> of Solomon<WH8010>, and will give<WH5414> ten<WH6235> tribes to you<WH7626>:

(But he shall have one<WH259> tribe<WH7626> for my servant<WH5650> David<WH1732>'s sake<WH3389>, and for Jerusalem's sake<WH5892>, the city which I have chosen<WH977> out of all the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478>:)

Because that they have forsaken<WH5800> me<WH7812>, and have worshiped Ashtoreth<WH6253> the goddess<WH430> of the Zidonians<WH6722>, Chemosh<WH3645> the god<WH430> of the Moabites<WH4124>, and Milcom<WH4445> the god<WH430> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, and have not walked<WH1980> in my ways<WH1870>, to do<WH6213> that which is right<WH3477> in my eyes<WH5869>, and to keep my statutes<WH2708> and my judgments<WH4941>, as did David<WH1732> his father<WH1>.

But I will not take<WH3947> the whole kingdom<WH4467> out of his hand<WH3027>: but I will make<WH7896> him prince<WH5387> all the days<WH3117> of his life<WH2416> for David<WH1732> my servant<WH5650>'s sake<WH977>, whom I chose, because he kept<WH8104> my commandments<WH4687> and my statutes<WH2708>:
But I will take<WH3947> the kingdom<WH4410> out of his son<WH1121>'s hand<WH3027>, and will give<WH5414> it unto you<WH6235>, even ten tribes<WH7626>.

And unto his son<WH1121> will I give<WH5414> one<WH259> tribe<WH7626>, that David<WH1732> my servant<WH5650> may have a window<WH5216> always<WH3117> before<WH6440> me in Jerusalem<WH3389>, the city<WH5892> which I have chosen<WH977> me to put<WH7760> my name there<WH8034>.
And I will take<WH3947> you<WH4427>, and you shall reign according to all that your soul<WH5315> desires<WH183>, and shall be king<WH4428> over Israel<WH3478>.

And it shall be<WH8085>, if you will listen unto all that I command<WH6680> you<WH1980>, and will walk in my ways<WH1870>, and do<WH6213> that is right<WH3477> in my sight<WH5869>, to keep<WH8104> my statutes<WH2708> and my commandments<WH4687>, as David<WH1732> my servant<WH5650> did<WH6213>; that I will be with you<WH1129>, and build you a sure<WH539> house<WH1004>, as I built<WH1129> for David<WH1732>, and will give<WH5414> Israel unto you<WH3478>.
And I will for this afflict<WH6031> the seed<WH2233> of David<WH1732>, but not for ever<WH3117>.

Solomon<WH8010> sought<WH1245> therefore to kill<WH4191> Jeroboam<WH3379>. And Jeroboam<WH3379> arose<WH6965>, and fled<WH1272> into Egypt<WH4714>, unto Shishak<WH7895> king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714>, and was in Egypt<WH4714> until the death<WH4194> of Solomon<WH8010>.

And the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Solomon<WH8010>, and all that he did<WH6213>, and his wisdom<WH2451>, are they not written<WH3789> in the book<WH5612> of the acts<WH1697> of Solomon<WH8010>?
And the time<WH3117> that Solomon<WH8010> reigned<WH4427> in Jerusalem<WH3389> over all Israel<WH3478> was forty<WH705> years<WH8141>.

And Solomon<WH8010> slept<WH7901> with his fathers<WH1>, and was buried<WH6912> in the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732> his father<WH1>: and Rehoboam<WH7346> his son<WH1121> reigned in his stead<WH4427>.
